item.title: Languages of Truth
item.description: I discovered this book when I accidentally stumbled upon a very excellent but unceremonious NYTimes Review. I haven’t read much since last august (except 2 books) and two books of Rushdie’s are sitting idly in my kindle catching digital dust, yet I really wanted to read this for no other reason apart from the fact that the reviewer mentioned “The Underground Railroad” and “Lincoln in the Bardo” - two books, that did not infact collect dust, digital or otherwise and that I immensely enjoyed - as a defense against rushdie’s take.
